notes: The prefixed version, -webkit-border-radius, is supported since version 1.0.
Chrome versions ignore border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate valu.e
A prefixed version, -moz-border-radius, is supported from Firefox 1.0 to Firefox 12 (included).
Since Firefox 49.0, the prefixed version -webkit-border-radius is also supported
Before Firefox 50.0, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Gecko 50.0
A prefixed version, -moz-border-radius, is supported from Firefox 1.0 to Firefox 12 (included).
Since Firefox 49.0, the prefixed version -webkit-border-radius is also supported
Before Firefox 50.0, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Gecko 50.0
In Opera prior to version 11.60, applying border-radius to replaced elements will not have rounded corners.
The prefixed version, -webkit-border-radius, is supported since version 3.0.
Safari versions ignore border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate value.
<percentage> values are implemented in a non-standard way prior to Gecko 2.0. Both horizontal and vertical radii were relative to the width of the border box.
<percentage> values are implemented in a non-standard way prior to Gecko 2.0. Both horizontal and vertical radii were relative to the width of the border box.
The implementation of <percentage> values was buggy in Opera prior to 11.50.

Chrome versions prior to WebKit 532.5 don't support the slash / notation. If two values are specified, an elliptical border is drawn on all four corners. -webkit-border-radius: 40px 10px; is equivalent to border-radius: 40px/10px;.

Safari versions prior to WebKit 532.5 don't support the slash / notation. If two values are specified, an elliptical border is drawn on all four corners. -webkit-border-radius: 40px 10px; is equivalent to border-radius: 40px/10px;.
Chrome versions prior to WebKit 532.5 support only one value for all four corners. For different radii the border-top-left-radius long form properties must be used.
Safari versions prior to WebKit 532.5 support only one value for all four corners. For different radii the border-top-left-radius long form properties must be used.
